person.persName: Pleasant M. Savage (Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and presiding judge)

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and presiding judge. Virginia native. Married to Susannah Swingle Savage in Lewis County, Kentucky, on December 5, 1812. Father of George Swingle Savage and Harriet Savage. Married to Sarah A. Moore Savage. Father of Mary Moore Savage, Sam Savage, Alfred Savage, Franklin "Francis" M. Savage, and Sarah Savage. Resident in Lewis County in 1820. Owned seventy-five enslaved persons in Lewis County in 1820. Resident in Lewis County in 1830. Owned three enslaved persons in Lewis County in 1830. U.S. Postmaster in Lewis County from January 2, 1833, to September 15, 1837. Resident in Greenup County in 1840. Owned five enslaved persons in Greenup County in 1840. Farmer in Lewis County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Lewis County in 1850. Merchant in Louisa in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Lawrence County in 1860. Presiding judge in Lawrence County from 1862 to 1863.
